posts.title: Groundwaves Concludes 2022 Series In Springdale
posts.content:
Groundwaves, sponsored by CACHE, gathers local hip-hop artists around an open mic to share their work and receive real-time feedback from legendary west-coast rapper Murs. 

  • Reflections: Murs sat down with KUAF's Jasper Logan to reflect on the series and discuss the importance of established artists investing in and supporting younger generations of artists. 
  • Looking forward: CACHE is excited to continue working with Murs and NW Arkansas’s hip-hop community to keep growing the program in 2023. 

Listen to the conversation HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Happy Hallo-weekend, NWA! Here are some ideas to get your fun started. 

  • Trick or tree: Fayetteville is hosting its 24th annual Celebration of Trees giveaway this Saturday, Oct 29 at 7a in the Spring St. Parking Garage. 
  • Chocolate, please : Trick or Treat the Bentonville Farmers Market Saturday, Oct 29. 
  • Aim for their heads: Join a zombie horde as it parades through Eureka Springs in the Zombie Crawl this Saturday, Oct 29 beginning at 6p. 
  • Crawlers: Join the Dickson St. Halloween Pub Crawl and costume contest on Saturday, Oct 29 from 5-10p. 
  • Remember the dead: Join the first part of Dia de Muertos celebration in Downtown Springdale with the building of the ofrenda at Shiloh Square on Sunday, Oct 30 from 12-5p. 
  • Hauling fright: Hop aboard the Halloween or haunted train cars in Downtown Springdale this weekend for a freight-load of fun! 
  • Kraft a great weekend: Find the best pumpkin patches, corn mazes, fall festivals, and more on Macaroni KID’s Fall & Halloween Guide. 

Now go! Win that costume contest! Scare a trick-or-treater! And secure the candy bag!

posts.title: The NWA Council Delivers 2022 State Of The Region Report
posts.content:
Yesterday, the Center for Business and Economic Research and the NWA Council released their annual State of the Region report. 

  • Looking good: Compared to peer metros, NWA had one of the lowest unemployment rates, has seen tremendous population growth, and its citizens enjoy some of the shortest commute times. 
  • Looking ahead: NWA remains ranked low in other metrics such as average annual wages, percentage of adults without bachelor’s degrees, and low spending on research and development. All of which are metrics the NWA Council is seeking to address, particularly in the area of affordable housing and the establishment of more walkable communities.

Read the full State of the Region report HERE.

posts.title: America’s Most Haunted Hotel
posts.content:
What better way to celebrate Halloween than to explore one of the area’s most infamously haunted places, The Crescent Hotel, built in 1886. 

  • A full moon: Eureka Springs’ Crescent Hotel has been called America’s most haunted hotel. For years, folks have reported ghost sightings, and in 2019 glass jars with human specimens inside were found buried on the property.
  • Malpractice: The jars and other artifacts like a bone-saw were attributed to Norman Baker, a con-artist playing doctor, who used the hotel as a cancer hospital in the 1930’s and the basement as his morgue. 

Explore more of the area’s haunted places HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
